articles.title: SPA Delegation Leaves for Zambia
articles.content:
SPA Delegation Leaves for Zambia
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly headed by its deputy Ri Jong Hyok, president of the National Reunification Institute, left here on Thursday to participate in the 134th conference of the Inter-Parliamentary Union to be held in Zambia.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Mongolian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Mongolian Ambassador
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him Thursday.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian embassy here hosted a reception on Thursday to mark the 67th anniversary of conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Invited to the reception were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Hwang Ho Nam, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present there were Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Donates Teaching Materials to Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Donates Teaching Materials to Kim Il Sung University
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian embassy here donated teaching materials to Kim Il Sung University on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, handed them to an official of the university on Thursday.

articles.title: Cuban Diplomats Tour Int'l Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Cuban Diplomats Tour Int'l Friendship Exhibition House
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and members of his embassy toured the International Friendship Exhibition House on Thursday on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of Fidel Castro Ruz's visit to the DPRK.
					 They looked round gifts presented to the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu by party leaders, heads of state and government and prominent figures of many countries.

articles.title: DPRK's Statements Distributed as UNGA and UNSC Official Documents
articles.content:
DPRK's Statements Distributed as UNGA and UNSC Official Documents
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK government and the March 4 statement by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry were distributed as the UN General Assembly and UN Security Council's official document A/70/776-S/2016/214 on March 15.
					 And the March 7 statement issued by the DPRK National Defence Commission and the March 6 statement by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry were distributed as an official document A/70/778-S/2016/222 on March 16.

articles.title: Seminar of Social Scientists Held
articles.content:
Seminar of Social Scientists Held
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A seminar of social scientists to deeply study and grasp the idea of the self-development-first principle indicated by Marshal Kim Jong Un was held at the Academy of Social Sciences Thursday. 
					 The participants heard papers scientifically and theoretically explaining and proving the validity and vitality of the idea and theory of the self-development-first principle indicated by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The speakers said that the principle is the revolutionary spirit to remarkably redouble one's strength by dint of the driving force and to hew out one's future by oneself.
					
					 They said that the principle regarded the Juche revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il as its starting point and fundamentals.
					
					 They explained about the important requirements for pushing ahead with the building of a thriving socialist nation in reliance on self-development-first principle.
					
					 They expressed their determination to contribute to bringing earlier a final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche by waging dynamic all-out offensive toward the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with the idea of the principle set forth by Kim Jong Un as their lifeline. 
					
					 Present there were Ri Hye Jong, president of the Academy of Social Sciences, officials concerned, teachers, researches, lecturers and journalists in the fields of science, education, media and preservation of revolutionary sites and organs of training party officials.

articles.title: Members of Women's Union Conduct Brisk Agitation for Increased Production
articles.content:
Members of Women's Union Conduct Brisk Agitation for Increased Production
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Organizations and members of the women's union across the country are powerfully encouraging the working people all out in the 70-day campaign.
					 More than 250,000 officials of primary organizations and members of the women's union across the country are involved in the above-said activities.
					
					 Officials and members of the Pyongyang City Committee of the women's union visited the Kim Il Sung Stadium in the process of remodeling, Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill and the construction site of second-stage remodeling project of the Central Zoo to encourage the builders and employees.
					
					 The South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the women's union conducted frontline-style agitation for increased production at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and other places.
					
					 The South Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the women's union organized at least 60 art squads to conduct intensive agitation.
					
					 Women's union organizations in all parts of the country including North Phyongan, Kangwon and North Hwanghae Provinces are conducting successful agitation to encourage working people to bring about unprecedented miracles and innovations in the general offensive for greeting the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with signal labor successes.

articles.title: Graduating Students of Senior Secondary School Meet
articles.content:
Graduating Students of Senior Secondary School Meet
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The presentation of poems and songs "Era and Youth" took place at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre from March 11 to 17. It was given by graduating class students of senior secondary schools in Pyongyang who volunteered to serve the Korean People's Army (KPA) at the forefront posts and to work in difficult and labor-consuming fields.
					 The performers at the presentation renewed their will to dedicate their youth to serving the KPA at the forefront posts and working in the key fields for building an economy power.
					
					 A war veteran earnestly asked the young people in the era of Marshal Kim Jong Un to fly at the military parade square for reunification the flag of the DPRK associated with the whole lives of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and blood shed by the revolutionary forerunners down through generations.
					
					 Put on the stage were song "O Mother Party Which Protected My Destiny", etc. Pervading the presentation venue was the spirit of the participants to display the might of the youth power.

articles.title: Conditions for Preschool Education Improve in DPRK
articles.content:
Conditions for Preschool Education Improve in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A work has been launched in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to better the conditions and environment of preschool education.
					 An e-education program (multimedia), developed by Phalgol Kindergarten No. 2 in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang is being introduced to kindergartens throughout the country. This program contains more than 1 400 pieces of documentation, pictures and audio and video data needed for the education of children. It helps teachers make preparations for teaching and give the children more vivid vision of playing methods.
					
					 Meanwhile, distributed to all kindergartens in the country were five maps on Korea suited to children's mentality--a map on the administrative divisions, a natural map and maps on animal, plant and resources distribution. They are very helpful to fostering patriotism among the children.
					
					 Also, a brisk campaign goes on to install solar panels at every kindergarten.
					
					 The DPRK government has given priority to the education of children, regarding them as a king of the country.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Dismisses U.S. Far-fetched Assertion about DPRK's Satellite Launch
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Dismisses U.S. Far-fetched Assertion about DPRK's Satellite Launch
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The world public is becoming increasingly assertive about the justice of the satellite launch of the DPRK.
					 Recently, various international bodies and experts verified the fact that the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 was launched to use space for peaceful purposes from A to Z.
					
					 A doctor at a cosmophysics center of the U.S. on March 10 said that a satellite of north Korea is going round the earth along its orbit, acknowledging the credibility of the assertion that it is an earth observation satellite.
					
					 Its orbit is clearly displayed on the website tracking the satellite in real time on the basis of the data sent by the North American Aero-space Defense Command.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is still describing the DPRK's satellite launch as a "provocative act of escalating tensions", terming it a "long-range missile" test-fire. This is, indeed, a far-fetched assertion.
					
					 The DPRK's activities for developing outer space for peaceful purposes were compelled to cover an untrodden difficult path owing to the U.S. and other forces disturbing them. 
					
					 The U.S. and other hostile forces, regarding the DPRK, an independent country, as a thorn in their flesh, used to term its satellite liftoff for peaceful purposes a "long-range missile" launch and force the UN to meet their brigandish demands.
					
					 No article of the UN Charter allows the UNSC to deprive any country of its right to peaceful use of outer space stipulated in international law.
					
					 Should the DPRK's satellite launch be called into question, all the countries including the U.S. which launched satellites should be taken to task. History records more than 9 000 satellite launches but the UNSC has never adopted a resolution banning them, except for the DPRK's satellite liftoffs.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the U.S. launched intercontinental ballistic missile Minuteman-3 in its mainland recently.
					
					 Reuters reported that the U.S. test-fired Minuteman-3 against the backdrop of the escalating tension in Korea, adding that its test-fire totaled 15 since 2011.
					
					 The U.S. should give up its sinister attempt to deprive the sovereign state of its independent and legitimate right and immediately stop its brazen-faced action against satellite launches for peaceful purposes.

articles.title: Newspapers Mark Anniversary of First Agreement between DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
Newspapers Mark Anniversary of First Agreement between DPRK and Russia
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of the DPRK Thursday dedicate articles to the anniversary of the first agreement between the DPRK and Russia.
					 An agreement on economic and cultural cooperation was signed between the DPRK and the Soviet Union on March 17, 1949. It was the first one between the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 Since the historic day the two countries have boosted the ties of friendship, steadily developing cooperation and exchange in economic, cultural and other fields on the basis of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation for more than six decades, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 Mutual visits and contacts have become brisk at various levels and wide-ranging views have been exchanged on issues of bilateral relations and international matters.
					
					 Multifarious cooperative work was pushed forward and diverse political and cultural events took place in recent years, especially last year, the year of friendship between the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 The DPRK and Russia are neighbors and their ties are the traditional relations of friendship with a long history.
					
					 The whole course of the development of the relations between the two countries proved that the DPRK-Russia friendly ties are in full line with the common aspiration, wishes and interests.
					
					 To value and develop the DPRK-Russia friendly relations is favorable for ensuring development and stability in the two countries and peace and stability in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It is possible to develop the friendly relations on a fresh stage under any circumstances and situation only when the peoples of the two countries add shine to the history of the bilateral relations of development and the tradition of friendship and cooperation forged by the joint efforts.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the DPRK-Russia friendly relations will grow stronger thanks to the desire and wishes of the two peoples to develop them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Denying Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Denying Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Recently, the Japanese Foreign Ministry opened to public a document full of absurd assertions that the testimonies to the forcible drafting of sexual slaves by the state power made in the past are "lies" and "fabrications."
					 Earlier, the Japanese authorities, answering a question raised by the UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women as regards the sexual slavery, claimed results of "comprehensive fact-finding" proved that the "evidence of forcible drafting of comfort women by the army and government organs was not confirmed."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in an article that their claim is a blatant challenge to the truth of the stark history.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Japan's sinister intention of persistently denying the fact well known to the world is to keep buried into oblivion its crime-woven history and embellish its past crimes in a bid to lay a springboard for the revival of militarism and reinvasion.
					
					 Since its defeat, Japan has worked hard to evade the responsibility to redress its past crimes through distortion and denial of history, but it is a foolish act.
					
					 It is the only option for Japan to sincerely admit its past crimes and make honest apology and reparation for them.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Enters into More Reckless Phase
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Enters into More Reckless Phase
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military exercises of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers have entered into more reckless phase.
					 While frantically staging the largest-ever joint military drills against the DPRK throughout south Korea under the dangerous war plan aimed at attacking the supreme leadership of the DPRK and "bringing down its social system", the enemies began "scenario for attack drill part 2" the keynote of which is the "operation for advance into the northern inland area" targeting the strategic key areas of the DPRK on March 14.
					
					 The Operation Command No. 2 of the puppet army waged a drill for rapidly infiltrating and deploying special warfare forces in the operation theatre on March 14.
					
					 On March 15 the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and units of the south Korean puppet army waged urban battle drill in Phochon, Kyonggi Province.
					
					 An engineering unit of the U.S. Second Combat Air Force Wing and a unit of the Seventh Engineering Brigade of the south Korean puppet army ran amuck with joint river crossing exercises.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Drills against DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Drills against DPRK Slammed
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Regional Headquarters of the Commonwealth of Independent States of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on March 8 denounced the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group for their war drills against the north.
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers kicked off the largest-ever joint military drills against the DPRK despite unanimous public opposition and rebuff at home and abroad, creating the greatest danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that it is impossible to achieve the peace on the peninsula and the nation's reconciliation and unity as long as the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group's madcap saber-rattling is allowed to go on.
					
					 It is entirely just for the DPRK to resolutely stand up against the war drills being staged by the hordes of gangsters to infringe upon the nation's sovereignty.

articles.title: No-war Actions Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
No-war Actions Launched in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Actions for peace against war were launched in eight areas of south Korea on March 14 protesting against the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers' joint military exercises targeting the DPRK.
					 Press conferences, one-man demo and propaganda activities were staged by the civic and public organizations in Seoul, Inchon, Pusan, Ulsan, Iksan, Mokpho, Kwangyang and Sunchon.
					
					 The organizations strongly accused the U.S. and south Korean authorities of staging the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military exercises involving hugest-ever nuclear war hardware and troops.
					
					 Saying that they oppose the above-said drills bringing the dark clouds of a war to hang over the Korean peninsula, they called for defending the people's rights to independence and existence.
					
					 They urged the U.S. and south Korea to immediately stop their war drills.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Deplores Maltreatment of Juveniles
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Deplores Maltreatment of Juveniles
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore Monday carried an editorial ridiculing society where juveniles are under maltreatment.
					 The editorial citied the disclosure of a tragic fact that a 7-year child was dead after being ill treated by his father and stepmother.
					
					 This case came when the south Korean public was shocked by a chain of juvenile maltreatment being reported one after another, it said, adding:
					
					 The regime claimed it took relevant measures but none of them had effectiveness.

articles.title: Koreans in Tohoku, Japan Meet
articles.content:
Koreans in Tohoku, Japan Meet
Tokyo, March 16 (KNS-KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of Koreans in Tohoku, Japan at the Tohoku Korean primary and secondary school in Miyagi Prefecture on March 12 on the lapse of five years since the great earthquake in east Japan.
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the memory of Korean victims.
					
					 Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), said leader Kim Jong Il sent a message of sympathy and consolatory money to the Korean victims of the unprecedented large earthquake and tidal wave five years ago. It was benevolent loving care and precious life-giving water which saved those Koreans in Japan who were left hopeless, he added.
					
					 Speeches were made. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting officials of Chongryon conducted sympathy activities for Korean victims.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK, Anti-Chongryon Moves Denounced in Japan
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK, Anti-Chongryon Moves Denounced in Japan
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Gunma Prefectural Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity made public a statement on March 1 condemning the Japanese regime for its criminal acts against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The ill-advised independent sanctions slapped by the Japanese government against the DPRK over its self-defensive H-bomb test and satellite launch for peaceful purposes are an act of extremely escalating confrontation between the two countries, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is a clear manifestation of politically-motivated suppression of Chongryon and abuses of the human rights of the Koreans in Japan that the Japanese regime tightened its embargo on reentry of all Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan without limitation.
					
					 Sanctions can never help improve the Japan-DPRK relations and achieve peace on the Korean peninsula. Now is just the time for the Japanese regime to have a dialogue with the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Followers Should Respect DPRK's Sovereignty: Russian Organization
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Followers Should Respect DPRK's Sovereignty: Russian Organization
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and its followers should respect the DPRK's sovereignty.
					 The Maritime Territorial Branch of the All-Russia War Veterans' Social Organization "Militant Fraternity" was quoted as saying this in a statement on March 9 protesting against the UN Security Council's unreasonable "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK.
					
					 Extending full support to the DPRK's stance to defend its sovereignty and national right to existence, the statement read:
					
					 The DPRK is ensuring happy and stable life of its people.
					
					 All the Korean people are supporting the DPRK government.
					
					 We denounce the unreasonable "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK, which will escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK government is making every possible effort for its people's happiness and children's rosy future.
					
					 We will enthusiastically support and encourage the Korean people's just struggle.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced by Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced by Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association released a statement on March 8 in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korea massive joint military exercises.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. and its followers should not pose a war threat to the DPRK and seek its "collapse" but opt for a dialogue with it.
					
					 Big powers should immediately stop interfering in the internal affairs of the DPRK.
					
					 Laying bare the scale, purpose and danger of the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military exercises of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces, it went on:
					
					 The war drills are dangerous as they might lead to an outbreak of a new war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association bitterly denounces the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers' reckless moves to raise tensions on the Korean peninsula and demand their immediate stop.
					
					 Such hostile acts will aggravate the situation on the peninsula.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Denounced by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Denounced by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan released a statement on March 9 in denunciation of the U.S. and south Korean warmongers' madcap military exercises to invade the north.
					 History and the present situation show once again that the U.S. imperialists are the root cause of all misfortune and pain the Korean people have undergone and the cancer-like entity blocking peace and reunification of Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Not only peace and reunification of Korea but also peace in Northeast Asia are unthinkable as long as the U.S. imperialists are present in south Korea and the Park Geun Hye group bereft of soul as Koreans stay in power.
					
					 The confederation urged the U.S. and south Korean authorities to stop at once the war exercises, coming to their senses, though belatedly.

articles.title: "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Slammed by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
"Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Slammed by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on a website an article titled "'Sanctions resolution' can by no means be justified" on March 6.
					 The article said that the U.S. pressed the UN Security Council to cook up another harsh "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK, pulling up it over its H-bomb test and satellite launch for peaceful purposes. It went on:
					
					 The DPRK had access to nuclear weapons to cope with the hostile acts and persistent nuclear threat of the U.S., the world biggest nuclear weapons state.
					
					 As for the satellite launch, it is the legitimate right of a sovereign state.
					
					 The UNSC is not entitled to deprive a UN member state of its right to use space for peaceful purposes which is specified in international law.
					
					 In case the DPRK's satellite launch is faulted, it is necessary to find fault with all the satellite launchers including the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. is to blame for the rupture of the denuclearization on the Korean peninsula as it has refused to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills Blamed by Barbadian Organizations
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills Blamed by Barbadian Organizations
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Barbados Caribbean Movement for Peace and Integration and the Barbados Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People issued a joint statement on March 9 accusing the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers of their reckless nuclear war exercises.
					 The statement terms the largest-ever Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military exercises acts of bringing a war to the Korean peninsula and threatening regional peace and security.
					
					 Disclosing the scale and gravity of the recent joint military exercises, it urged the Caribbean Community and the UN to condemn the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for kicking off the joint military drills.

articles.title: Organization of DR Congo Supports Korean People's Struggle
articles.content:
Organization of DR Congo Supports Korean People's Struggle
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- We fully support the stand of the DPRK led by supreme leader Kim Jong Un and extend encouragement to the struggle of the Korean people for building a thriving nation.
					 The Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo noted this in a statement issued on March 8 as regards the fact that the U.S. let the UN Security Council fabricate another "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK's H-bomb test and satellite launch.
					
					 Recalling that the organization congratulated the DPRK on its first H-bomb test and successful launch of the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4, the statement said:
					
					 The U.S. and other big powers and hostile forces fabricated the unprecedentedly harsh "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK by abusing the name of the UNSC.
					
					 This is an unpardonable insult to a state fully exercising its right to existence and sovereignty and an inhuman act of internationally isolating and stifling the DPRK.
					
					 We resolutely denounce the U.S.-led UNSC's barbarous act as trickery against mankind.
					
					 The DPRK will emerge victorious.

articles.title: DPRK's Stand Supported by Swiss Bodies
articles.content:
DPRK's Stand Supported by Swiss Bodies
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in their joint statement on Mar. 8 supported the statements issued by the DPRK National Defence Commission and a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry denouncing Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military drills kicked off by the brigandish U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers.
					 Giving a detailed account of the statements, the joint statement said:
					
					 When a war breaks out, it will neither be confined to the Korean peninsula nor be fought with conventional weapons only.
					
					 It is quite just exercise of the right to self-defense for the DPRK to counter the U.S. provocation with a preemptive attack.
					
					 We will fully support the just preemptive attack of the Korean People's Army for defending the country and achieving national reunification. 
					
					 The Korean people are hoping for pulling the Yankee occupiers out of south Korea and reunifying the country with the strong strike of the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army, replete with a single desire to settle accounts with their sworn enemy.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Egypt
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Egypt
Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian preparatory committee for celebrating President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Cairo on March 11.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of the President in the period between March 12 and April 15.

articles.title: Efectuado en Corea seminario de ciencias sociales
articles.content:
Efectuado en Corea seminario de ciencias sociales
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en la Academia de Ciencias Sociales el seminario del sector de ciencias sociales para estudiar y asimilar profundamente la idea de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento aclarada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					En la ocasion fueron publicadas las disertaciones que explicaron y argumentaron en lo cientifico y teorico la justeza y la vitalidad de la idea y teoria de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento, presentadas por el Mariscal.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que la idea de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento es el espiritu revolucionario que permite fortalecer notablemente el poder propio apoyandose en las fuerzas autoctonas y abrir las puertas del futuro con las propias fuerzas.
					
					Tambien, esta idea que tiene como punto de partida la idea revolucionaria de los grandes Lideres, recalcaron.
					
					Se refirieron a las demandas importantes para acelerar vigorosamente la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista con la idea de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento, subrayaron.
					
					Y expresaron la decision de desarrollar dinamicamente la marcha general hacia el Septimo Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea tomando como linea de vida la idea de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento presentada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un y asi contribuir a adelantar la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					En el seminario estuvieron presentes Ri Hye Jong, presidenta de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales, los funcionarios de la rama interesada, los profesores, investigadores, conferenciantes y periodistas de los sectores de ciencias, educacion, prensa e informacion e historia revolucionaria, etc.

articles.title: ACNC rechaza injusta insistencia de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ACNC rechaza injusta insistencia de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Se alzan cada dia mas las voces de apoyo al lanzamiento de satelite de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Varias organizaciones internacionales y los especialistas confirman que el satelite de observacion de la Tierra Kwangmyongsong-4 de la RPDC fue lanzado con fines pacificos. 
					
					Un doctor del centro de la fisica espacial de EE.UU. estimo el pasado dia 10 que es autentica la insistencia en que el satelite del Norte de Corea es para la observacion de la Tierra diciendo que el satelite siempre gira por la orbita con la parte inferior hacia la Tierra. 
					
					Se puede ver claramente la orbita de nuestro satelite en el sitio Web de Internet que rastrea en tiempo real los satelites por mediacion de la Comandancia de las Fuerzas de Defensa Aerea y Espacial de Norteamerica. 
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio americano cuestiona injustamente el lanzamiento de satelite de la RPDC como "prueba de lanzamiento de misil de largo alcance" y "acto provocativo que aumenta la tension". 
					
					En el tiempo pasado tambien las actividades de desarrollo espacial con fines pacificos de la RPDC sufrieron muchas dificultades incognitas por EE.UU. y otros estorbadores.
					
					EE.UU. y otras fuerzas hostiles vinieron negando historicamente el caracter pacifico del lanzamiento de satelite de la RPDC, calificandolo de lanzamiento del "misil de larga distancia" e imponiendo a la ONU la demanda bandidesca considerando como pua clavada en el ojo a la RPDC que marcha por el camino de la independencia.
					
					En la Carta de la ONU no hay ni una frase que confiere al Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU la autoridad de privar del derecho al uso pacifico del cosmos estipulado en la ley internacional.
					
					Si se cuestiona el lanzamiento del satelite de la RPDC, tambien deben ser cuestionados EE.UU. y otros paises lanzadores de satelites. Hasta la fecha se realizo el lanzamiento de satelite mas de 9 mil veces, pero nunca se aprobo ni una resolucion del CS de la ONU sobre la prohibicion del lanzamiento de satelite.
					
					Lo mas grave es que EE.UU. que cuestionaba tanto el lanzamiento del satelite de la RPDC como prueba del lanzamiento del "misil de largo alcance", lanzo hace poco abiertamente el misil balistico intercontinental Minuteman-3 en su territorio principal.
					
					La agencia britanica Reuters transmitio que EE.UU. realizo la prueba del lanzamiento del misil arriba mencionado en su territorio en medio del aumento de la tension con la RPDC y revelo que su numero de veces llega a mas de 15 desde 2011.
					
					EE.UU. debe abandonar el intento malsano de quitar el derecho independiente y legitimo de un Estado soberano y retirar de inmediato el acto descarado en cuanto al lanzamiento del satelite con fines pacificos.

articles.title: Periodicos coreanos conmemoran el dia de firma de primer convenio entre RPDC y FR
articles.content:
Periodicos coreanos conmemoran el dia de firma de primer convenio entre RPDC y FR
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de concertacion del primer convenio entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa, los periodicos coreanos divulgaron el dia 17 articulos individuales.
					El 17 de marzo de 1949 fue concertado el primer convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y cultural entre la RPDC y la Union Sovietica.
					
					En su articulo, Rodong Sinmun recuerda que durante mas de 60 anos desde aquel dia historico, los dos paises han venido estrechando la cooperacion y el intercambio en la economia, cultura y otras ramas y profundizando el vinculo de amistad a  base de ese convenio.
					
					Se activaron el viaje y contacto de diversos rangos y se intercambiaron profundamente el criterio sobre el problema de relaciones bilaterales y los problemas internacionales, destaca el diario y continua:
					
					En los ultimos anos, en particular, en el anterior, ano de amistad RPDC-Rusia, en ambos paises se realizaron diversas cooperaciones y actividades politico-culturales.
					
					La RPDC y la FR son paises vecinos y las relaciones entre si son las tradicionales de amistad de larga historia.
					
					La trayectoria del desarrollo de relaciones entre ambos paises confirmo que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos  paises son convenientes enteramente a la aspiracion, deseo e interes mutuos.
					
					Apreciar y desarrollar estas relaciones de amistad son utiles para asegurar el desarrollo y la estabilidad en los dos paises y la paz y la estabilidad en la region del Noreste de Asia.
					
					Al glorificar la historia de desarrollo de relaciones entre ambos paises y las tradiciones de amistad y cooperacion preparadas gracias a los esfuerzos comunes, se pueden poner en la etapa mas alta las relaciones de amistad aun en medio de cualquier circunstancia y situacion.
					
					En su articulo, Minju Joson destaca que las relaciones bilaterales entre RPDC y FR se desarrollaran mas gracias a la aspiracion y la demanda de los pueblos de ambos paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon reconocer pasado criminal y hacer indemnizacion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon reconocer pasado criminal y hacer indemnizacion
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Japon dio a la publicidad un documento insistiendo injustamente en que son "falsos" e "inventados" los testimonios anteriores sobre el caracter forzoso de la esclavitud sexual segun el Poder estatal. 
					Con anterioridad, al responder a la pregunta formulada por el Comite de la Eliminacion de Discriminacion contra Mujeres de la ONU sobre el crimen de esclavitud sexual, las autoridades japonesas dijeron publicamente que segun la "averiguacion integral de los verdaderos aspectos no fueron confirmadas en ningun lugar las pruebas sobre el arresto forzoso de esclavas sexuales por parte del ejercito y organo gubernamental". 
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un articulo individual publicado este jueves, lo califica del desafio frontal a la verdad de la historia, y prosigue:
					
					La verdadera intencion de Japon que niega con teson los hechos reconocidos por el mundo reside en encubrir su pasado criminal y ocultar y justificar sus delitos del pasado para asi preparar el trampolin de resurgimiento del militarismo y de nueva agresion. 
					
					Despues de su derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, el pais isleno se valio de todos metodos injustos como la tergiversacion de la historia para liberarse de la responsabilidad de la liquidacion del pasado, pero en vano. 
					
					El unico remedio para Japon es reconocer su pasado criminal, pedir perdon sincero y hacer indemnizacion merecida.
